required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ARX788 in HER2-positive Breast Cancer Patients With Brain Metastases
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Single-arm, Single-center Phase II Clinical Study of Recombinant Humanized Anti-HER2 Monoclonal Antibody-AS269 Conjugate (ARX788) in the Treatment of HER2-positive Breast Cancer Patients With Brain Metastases

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 2 Study of ARX788 in HER2-positive, Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients whose Disease is resistant or refractory to Tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKI).

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, single arm, phase 2 study of ARX788 in HER2-positive, metastatic breast cancer patients whose disease is resistant or refractory to TKI. The ARX788 will be administered every 3 weeks (Q3W) intravenous (IV) infusion. In this study, Simon's two-stage design is used. Subjects received treatment until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, withdrawal from the study, or discontinuation judged by the investigator. Drug efficacy and safety data will be collected.

primary_outcome.measure: Central nervous system (CNS) clinical benefit rate (CBR)
primary_outcome.description: CNS CBR is defined as the percentage of subjects who have achieved complete response, partial response, and stable disease according to the Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Brain Metastases (RANO-BM) criteria

secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time between date of first dose of study therapy and date of progression or death, whichever occurs first, will be computed for response evaluable subjects. Subjects will be censored at time of subsequent therapy

Overall survival (OS) is defined as the time from first dose of study therapy to the date of death (any cause). Subjects who are alive will be censored at the last known time that the subject was alive
Record the organs where the disease first progressed during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of subjects experiencing adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Patient safety and adverse events (AEs) will be evaluated using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v.5.0. All AEs and serious adverse events (SAEs) will be assessed to determine the safety and tolerability of the treatment.

intervention.description: 1.5 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle.
